source.title: Inverted-U-shaped dopamine actions on human working memory and cognitive control

confidence_rationale: Constrains precision/vigor control to a nonlinear regime, supporting axis-specific guardrails rather than global monotone tuning.

mapping.source_claim_statement: Dopamine effects on control are nonlinear, with both low and high levels degrading performance depending on task and baseline.
mapping.ree_translation: Supports Q-017 guardrails: precision-like axis should be bounded and context-conditional rather than globally increasing.
mapping.mapping_caveat: Axis-specific pharmacology does not fully specify inter-axis coupling architecture.
mapping.source_context: Human neurocognitive synthesis on dopamine and control performance.

confidence_components.notes: Good constraint evidence; moderate transfer risk to synthetic agent control knobs.
